Company Description

H&M Group Business Tech presents a rare opportunity to play a key role in developing the future digital ecosystems for fashion, helping us create new revenue streams. Join us for your next career step!

Join a truly global team on our journey where you will be part of shaping our future communication experience for H&M colleagues all around the world by creating a colleague experience driving engagement and colleague satisfaction with tech and data. Now is the age to create a modern world class most commercial stores experience enabling our H&M group colleagues to delight and surprise our customers, tomorrow and in the future.  

Job Description

The PLM/CAD Software Engineer is responsible for maintaining and updating existing PLM-related software and developing new software solutions to address a specific need or solve a particular business problem. You will contribute to all development activities following appropriate methodologies and applying a repeatable, systematic, and quantifiable approach to the development process. This role also includes the build of environments according to H&M standards and working with business users and vendors to ensure all requirements are met, with the goal of deploying and maintaining the applications. The ideal candidate will apply DevOps practices to maintain and upgrade existing systems and investigate future technologies such as Cloud in line with H&Ms strategic vision.

To meet the Interiors team's expectations (Noncommercial goods), you will collect requirements and needs and be in close dialogue with different stakeholders throughout the organization. You like to roll up your sleeves and create at all levels to get the job done.

Specific areas of responsibility include:

	Drive the design, development, pipelines, and deployment of key PLM and CAD applications
	Communicating with product management and other teams about interfaces and dependencies
	All aspects of application management at an enterprise level, including client/server installations, configurations, packaging, deployment, maintenance, and support
	Integrate with DevOps infrastructure for continuous build, test, and deployment
	Ability to assess new technologies and determine a solution for enterprise implementation

Qualifications

You will need to have proven experience in the following:

	BS in science, technology, or engineering discipline
	5+ years of experience with administration of Siemens Teamcenter PLM and related CAD applications, preferably in the retail industry
	Strong knowledge in Programming and Database administration
	Agile, Scrum, DevOps experience preferred
	Preferable working in/with Cloud/Azure solutions
	Outstanding analytical, problem-solving, planning, and abstract thinking
	Multitasking ability to work both independently as well as in a team setting
	Integrate software with existing software/systems
	Knowledge of Software testing, quality assurance, and solutions testing, including automation
	Work closely with senior developers, software engineers, and data scientist to gain additional knowledge and expertise
	Document software solutions and ensure that technical documentation meets H&M standards

Additional Information

Please apply with a CV and Cover Letter before 2nd April 2021.

We are on an exciting journey to meet and exceed our customers' expectations today, tomorrow, and in the future. Rapid technological development and new customer behaviors are transforming the fashion retail industry. To cater to our millions of customers' individual needs and desires, Business Tech delivers technical solutions for all our brands' entire value chain.

The best ideas evolve when great minds with different perspectives get together. We're all on the same team in a global environment, and we learn from each other. There are endless opportunities to grow – your development is all up to you!

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and the background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users. H&M Group – Business Tech.
